title: Nidalee is a really fun and unique champion to play
body:
HOWEVER, she is honestly one of the worst champions in the game to play against for a few reasons. 

1. The Human Q: I'm completely fine with how much her spear is able to do. It is a hard skillshot to land, anyone saying otherwise probably hasn't played much Nidalee and is falsely claiming she's a super easy champion. What I'm not okay with is the fact that it's on a 6 second cooldown, 3.6 if you're like myself and many others who max out cdr every game. The mana cost is kind of negligible as well, 90 for max rank? After I'm finally oom from chucking spears for 20 minutes late game, I only have to wait a couple seconds to regen enough for another with only a morellos for mana regen/mana items. Increase the cooldown, increase the mana cost. She's got an entire set of abilities that don't cost mana, she can afford to spend a bit more while in human form. 

2. The Cougar W: No one enjoys infinite gap closers and low cd escapes, especially when hers is manaless. Honestly not much you can do here, and that on top of long range burst skillshot are kind of her identity as a champion, so I wouldn't change anything here. 

3. The Human E: The rest of her kit makes it extremely hard to lane against considering she's got a reset, manaless form, long range, an execute, 2 minute wards that trigger your passive which is a 4 second "Haha you can't go near your minions without dying" mark. On top of that you give her a heal with a .5 ratio (pretty damn great for a heal) ensuring any damage you do whether early game or late doesn't stick. It's infuriating for such a slippery champion to have a heal, and on top of that it gives a huge attack speed buff for **7 seconds**. That's an unnecessarily long time. My advice is to increase the heal's mana cost at early ranks, as of right now it's really not taxing enough not to spam, and lower the attack speed buff to 5 seconds, while increasing the base of the heal at all ranks so it's more impactful, yet less spammable at early ranks. 

TL;DR: My suggested changes: Increase Human Q cooldown to 7 seconds from 6, increase mana cost to 60/70/80/90/100 from 50/60/70/80/90. Increase Human E mana cost at early ranks to 80/90/100/110/120 from 60/75/90/105/120, decrease the duration of attack speed slow to 5 seconds from 7, increase base of heal to 65/105/145/185/225 from 45/85/125/155/205 to compensate. This way it costs more to use it at early ranks, but the heal is more impactful. I'd also stagnate Human W's mana cost at 40 from 40/45/50/55/60 as a bit of compensation for the increased mana cost on Q. Overall these are nerfs, but I don't think they're too heavy and there's room to compensate her further if needed.

Eh. Personally, I think her W in Human needs to be changed to something more active that can mark her opponents and do damage, that way her spear can be reduced in damage. Much like Elise, her kit is meant to have human form get the person somewhat low and then switch forms and go in for the kill. The difference between them is Nidalee has a heal that also provides AS, which doesn't go with her kit at all, in fact the heal itself likely should be changed and she should get a tiny heal when she presses Q in cougar form on a Marked target since she's literally biting into them and eat it. Would make a bit more sense and leave her E as something capable of being reworked while also adding proper counter play to her kit. 

Lower Human form Q, change W and E, add slight healing to cougar form Q on Hunted Targets. Adds counter play, less reliance on always using the spear for killing and most of your damage, plus her heal would be tied to Risk and Reward.

The damage on Q isn't the issue, a straight damage nerf to it wouldn't fix the problem of spammable spears and it would just make nidalee feel worse to play as while not addressing the issues. The issue is there's no drawback to firing off spears whenever you feel like it. A higher cooldown and mana cost would impact bad nidalee players heavily while not punishing good nidalee players that can consistently land spears. The W is fine, her whole kit is really fun to play, changing that isn't the point of these suggestions. The same for the heal mana cost increase, and at the same time you'd be getting a stronger heal, but it'd actually drain your mana if you spam it.

Straight up nerfing it and giving her better options with her W and E would fix the problem. Who cares if she spams spears for days? Ziggs, Ez, Xerath, and Kog all have long ranged abilities that can do a TON of damage and are very easily spammed without any thoughts of mana with just a blue buff. 

When you think about nerfing things, you can't just simply say 'This ability is now gated by mana, so it gets to do all your health in a single hit'. If Nid spears still had tree trunk sized hit boxs and did the same damage as before with the NEW items, it could cost 1k mana per spear and it wouldn't mean crap because it would one shot your damn carry. Mana should never be an excuse as to why it does a lot and then going along and saying 'It's spammable, so doing low damage shouldn't matter'. Hello Evelynn. Yes, mana costs and low damage that's spammable does go a long way. Eve is a prime example of that with her Q getting its mana cost thrown around often. More mana cost with it being highly spammable means with blue, it's too strong. Without blue, it's near worthless.

Yeah, but it still doesn't fit her OWN kit at ALL. She's always been considered a Mage and Assassin above all else, but they wanted to give her some sort of supporty-ish ability and gave her one of the more awkward choices that not only thematically doesn't fit, but as a solo champion, it doesn't have an actual fit for a Poke champion. It would be similar to Ziggs, Xerath, or the like having a random heal thrown in or Jayce sitting there with a heal. It just wouldn't make much sense and on her, it really doesn't. Her kit has been and always will be to get the person low in human form, then go in for the kill as cougar form. When they reworked her kit a little bit in season 4, they made sure to change her to be more like that with her kit 'Hunting' the enemies, getting them low with her ranged poke, then going in for the kill. They gave her the tools to do this properly, yet they didn't take into affect that her E doesn't fit into that. Her E in cougar form is a generic AoE hit meant to help with wave clear and doing some good AoE damage, which is fine. Her E in human form is a generic Heal on a targeted ally. Why? Why would she have that STILL? 

They wanted to shift Nidalee into being an AP Assassin that pokes her enemies down and then dives in for the kill on the targets she's hunting, so WHY would she need to be able to heal her allies at the same time? She's not like Sona any of the other three supports that poke well and heal and her kit has been shifted from originally being a supporty-ish one to being a true AP Assassin. So why does she need a heal? WHY? WHY DOES SHE NEED IT? She ISN'T a support, she had her AD build reduced, her traps are near useless, and because of this, all of her power is shoved into pressing Q in human form and then running away in Cougar. Why is her kill potential shoved all into a single human form ability without any other kind of synergy? Jayce has special interactions between his E and Q while his W is a standard steroid that FITS HIS KIT when in ranged form. Elise's human form abilities are all about capturing her prey and quickly draining their health bar down, then going in for the kill as spider form. So why does Nidalee have a god damn Heal and a useless W? Every last bit of her power in human form is shoved into her Q because she has no other use in human form damage-wise. Absolutely NOTHING else. Her E helps push towers, but so does her Q in cougar form and her W in cougar form can help proc Lich/Runeglaive. You can argue that her heal helps her jungle, then give her a small heal on her Cougar form Q if it kills a target since she's chomping into her opponent and ripping it off, may as well eat it. She gets sustain, but has to put RISK into it and it lets her human form get a new E that might actually help her in lane. 

Riot let her hunt targets because she was near useless in lane. All she had was her Q so if you dodged her Q in lane, which is easy with minions, she can't get close to you or do anything. The only reason she saw laning success was because laning let her get gold to be able to throw tree trunk sized spears at carries for 160% of her AP plus almost 600 base damage. Most AP combos total 200%-250% of their AP and Nid got to do over half that in just a spear. That got nerfed to 450 plus 150% of her AP though and the spears got turned into toothpicks while she got kill potential in her cougar form. Well, why not shed off some of that power off her Q and put it into a new damaging ability on her E that could let her hunt targets? Give her kill potential in lane? Her late game oppression would be highly tuned down because of her Q being nerfed a bit, but her team fighting could be increased, her lane pressure could easily exist, and she'd still do well in the jungle.

-Gap closer
